channel.title: Open Science on Tools for Academic Research
channel.description: Recent content in Open Science on Tools for Academic Research

item.title: Open Textbooks
item.description: Free, adaptable, openly licensed textbooks and supplemental resources.

item.title: Connected Papers
item.description: Explore connected papers in a visual graph

item.title: Sci-Hub - Academic Papers for All
item.description: sh can helping people getting academic papers for free

item.title: AMiner
item.description: AI Powered Research Career: rankings of researchers, academic institutes, and conferences; trends of research topics; datasets for research.

item.title: Zenodo
item.description: Make anything citable by publishing on Zenodo and getting a DOI code.

item.title: OSF: Open Science Framework
item.description: OSF is a free, open platform to support your research and enable collaboration.

item.title: Duecredit
item.description: duecredit is being conceived to address the problem of inadequate citation of scientific software and methods, and limited visibility of donation requests for open-source software.

item.title: Protocols Io
item.description: Create, share, and collaborate on protocals. Protocals.io is not only for biologist, it can be used for any protocals.

item.title: Dryad
item.description: The Dryad Digital Repository stores curated data.

item.title: Cocalc
item.description: A toolkit for coding and writing online. The UI is a bit outdated but the services are real hardcore.

item.title: Azure Notebooks
item.description: Azure notebooks is simply a hosted Jupyter notebook.

item.title: Kaggle
item.description: Kaggle is a competition platform that bundles online computing Jupyter notebooks and data management.

item.title: Next Journal
item.description: NextJournal is the notebook for reproducible research. NextJournal provides poly-language notebooks and beautiful UI.

item.title: Google Colab
item.description: Google Colab is an online version of Jupyter Notebook which allows us to use free computation powers from Google and storage on Google Drive. Google Colab also comes with free GPU hours.
